title: Flight 93 National Memorial: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons       Memorial Hours  Grounds are open sunrise to sunset, year around including all holidays.  Please be aware that adverse weather conditions may result in closures.   Visitor Center Hours Open: 9:00 a.m. Close: 5 p.m.  The Visitor Center is open daily including holidays unless noted below: New Year's Day: Closed Martin Luther King, Jr. Day:  Closed Thanksgiving Day:  Closed Christmas Day:  Closed The memorial grounds are open 365 days a year. Seasons Forecast for Shanksville, PA Fall-Winter Generally, cooler weather starts in September with warm days and cool nights. The first snowfall of the season occurs by mid-October and extends through late March to mid-April. Throughout most of the winter, the daytime temperatures range in the mid-20s to 30s, with periodic warming in the 40s and 50s. It is often windy and wind chill is a major factor. Be prepared for adverse winter conditions: wind, snow, and ice. The average annual snowfall is approximately 80 inches for Somerset County. Spring-Summer May is more predictable for warmer weather with daytime temperatures in the 60s and 70s. July and August are seasonably warm for the area with high humidity and temperatures in the high 80s or 90s.
